programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes with Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lifelong escape artist, Forrest Tucker, ends up in San Quentin prison; despite his advanced age, he manages to engineer an audacious prison break.

programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes with Morgan Freeman

programme.desc: An Iranian-American psychopath goes to the men's city jail in Orange County Jail in Southern California; before he gets sent to a higher security prison, he escapes by crawling up the plumbing chase and rappelling down the side of the prison.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While conducting a drilling operation at the Triangle Area, the team not only detects dangerous energy spikes, but also discovers something that may have come from outer space.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team uses high-powered Tesla coils to shoot electricity into the oddly conductive soil of Skinwalker Ranch, it stimulates an otherworldly encounter.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team launches high-tech rockets into the mile-high zone above the Triangle, unidentified aerial phenomena suddenly appear.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As members of the team investigate the Triangle area nearly a mile above the ranch in Brandon's helicopter, they are shadowed by an invisible entity.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team returns for its third year to investigate the high strangeness of Skinwalker Ranch, it finds new evidence of a mysterious anomaly in the sky one mile above the Triangle Area that may be connected to something deep within the Mesa.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: The team invites former members of the U.S. military connected to the infamous "Tic Tac" UAP encounter, and are stunned when they stimulate very similar phenomena to appear above Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Secret of Skinwalker Ranch

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1980s, the FBI matches wits with a cunning bank robber -- a lone gunman responsible for the longest string of unsolved bank robberies in FBI history. The robber's planning is meticulous. He executes his crimes with military precision. It will take the combined skills of local police and dozens of agents to catch a criminal mastermind they call, "The Shootist."

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, Texas was terrorized by a brutal serial killer who traveled by train. The FBI assembled a task force to gather information about the dangerous drifter and create a profile that would help locate him. As they learned that the killer had traveled extensively through the United States and Mexico, the murders became more frequent, and authorities had to cast a dragnet over an entire continent in an effort to catch him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, Seven inmates break out of a high security prison in New Mexico. The escapees, all violent criminals, are a threat to anyone who crosses their path. State and local police and the FBI know they must capture these men before they rob, rape and kill…again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. Their MO was familiar -- the gang used precise timing to steal millions in cash and burned their getaway cars to destroy evidence. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, Texas was terrorized by a brutal serial killer who traveled by train. The FBI assembled a task force to gather information about the dangerous drifter and create a profile that would help locate him. As they learned that the killer had traveled extensively through the United States and Mexico, the murders became more frequent, and authorities had to cast a dragnet over an entire continent in an effort to catch him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Washington D.C, a car bomb takes the life of a former ambassador and his secretary. The FBI is on the case and begins sifting through layers of a wide-ranging conspiracy. The scope of the investigation broadens when it becomes apparent that a foreign government, ruled by a ruthless dictator, ordered the attack. Agents and prosecutors must engage in a political tug-of-war to uncover the identities of the assassins.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Four inmates from a Delaware Correctional Center turn up missing in the middle of the night. A few hours later, a stolen vehicle is recovered; inside, one of the inmate's fingerprints is found, as well as the address book of one of the other fugitives. A multi-state manhunt ensues with the help of the FBI. A nearby robbery report is the agent's first tip, followed by a murder in the same neighborhood.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In New York, the FBI and local police join forces to battle the constant influx of Colombian cocaine into the city's ports. One detective goes undercover, posing as a Mafia wise-guy, and infiltrates a drug gang connected to Pablo Escobar's Medellin cartel. The detective must be bold, but cautious, taking on the role of a tough-guy, but always aware that if the gang suspects anything, they won't hesitate to kill him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim has been stabbed more than thirty times, and the crime scene is awash with her blood. Near her head, police discover a distinctive button with strands of thread still attached.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 54-year-old Gayle Isleib was ambushed in her Manchester, Connecticut driveway and shot to death. Now police must determine if love had turned into obsession... and a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Avis Banks and her unborn child were brutally murdered. The body was discovered by her fianc_ Keyon Pittman. Police learn Pittman was having affairs with other women and he became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This series profiles intriguing crimes where science catches the bad guy. Follow coroners, medical examiners, physicians, law enforcement officials, journalists and legal experts as they put together the pieces of the crime puzzle.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, the Florida mobile home of Effie and Michael Ratley catches fire and Michael heroically rescues his wife and infant son. A month later, his wife is found beaten to death in a bedroom of his parents' home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run accident claimed the life of a high school athlete, everyone in town mourned his passing. Finding the killer was a long shot at best.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, Dorothy Donovan was murdered in her Dover, Delaware home and police are skeptical when her son Charles Holden stated that she was murdered by a hitchhiker he had picked up.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, funeral director Lonnie Turner, Sr. was found shot to death. His son Lonnie Jr. became the prime suspect, particularly after it was discovered that the murder was committed with his gun. However, he had an alibi for the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Lives changed in the 20 years following an unsolved murder, and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed not only a clue no one had seen before but also the identity of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run boating accident caused the death of a popular young man, investigators faced the daunting task of searching for one boat among 1200 others.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Digital enhancement of security camera video shows that what appears to be a casual encounter is actually a forced abduction, leading to murder. When investigators suspect the crimes are not random, they fear a serial killer may be on the loose.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of a respected police officer was murdered in her own home. The crime went unsolved for more than a decade, and then a newly formed Cold Case Unit took a fresh look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After inspecting storm damage to a home in Tampa, the insurance assessor simply disappeared. Thirty hours later, her body was found in a nearby river. But the killer had been careless.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This episode documents a deadly bombing at a church in Oakwood, Illinois, in December 1997.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the number and volume of bloodstains at the scene was greater than usual, it was up to forensic scientists to find out why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim had ingested a massive amount of cyanide. An unlikely clue _ a flaw on a mailing envelope _ exposed a murderer who was willing to kill innocent people.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, construction manager Darrell North was found dead in his work trailer in Ft. Worth, Texas. When investigators arrived, they found that he had been stabbed 46 times, indicating a personal relationship between the victim and the attacker.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most unusual cases in forensic history. Investigators had to find a way to solve a murder case with evidence which consisted of a squashed tomato found at the crime scene, and tiny, pinpoint reflections of light in a photograph.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Patrick McRae was found dead in his Des Moines home and the crime scene was awash with blood. Analysis showed it had come from two people, one of whom was female.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, when Derrick Duehren returned to his Oregon home, it had burned to the ground and his wife Roxanne's charred remains were found in the rubble. Investigators set out to determine if it was an unfortunate accident or arson and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. programme.desc: Van and Deaq struggle to reconcile their different investigative styles when they go undercover to apprehend a murderous pimp. Soon they must make a life-or-death decision.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie arranges for Van and Deaq to work with Shane, a gang member they've apprehended, to infiltrate a Mexican gang. But Shane proves unreliable and consequences could be deadly.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq pursue a pair of robbers who use an all-girl valet service to gain access. After the guys learn their targets are lesbians, Billie goes undercover to solve this one.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie orders Van and Deaq to train a rookie cop, Jarod. The guys pursue two dangerous blackmailers, but Van is taken hostage. Jarod must take action on his own to save Van.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq infiltrate a criminal enterprise led by a thug who hires out-of-town assassins to kill cops. Meanwhile, Billie fends off the chief investigator from Internal Affairs.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Under increased pressure from the chief investigator of Internal Affairs, Rolland Hill, Billie decides to help Van and Deaq put an end to a recent spate of cop killings.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van, Billie, Deaq and a sexy young counterfeiter, Gretchen, devise a scheme to save Van's father, Raymond, and capture a crime boss.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq's assignment gets complicated when a witness turns out to be a former acquaintance, Cassidy Shaw. And assassin Sophia Jones soon joins forces with Cassidy.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to protect the 19-year-old daughter of a former arms dealer. But she hates her father, doesn't comprehend the danger and does not want to be protected.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq try to capture a violent psychopath whose killing spree doesn't seem to make sense. They cope with the frustration of a case that may be too bizarre even for them.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: As the birthday of Deaq's murdered brother approaches, Van and Billie realize that he's coping with painful memories.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie and Van go undercover to end the partnership between a crystal methamphetamine manufacturer, Murdoch Goucher, and a pornography producer, Lena, who distributes the drug.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After a long undercover operation, Van hopes for some relaxation. But his situation soon becomes life-threatening. Meanwhile, an uncovered secret could bring serious repercussions.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: When a killer named Nick McKussick uses Van, Deaq and Billie to gain control of an incredibly lucrative stash, the lives of countless unknown innocents depend on the cops' success.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Aly Michalka and Ashley Tisdale lead an ensemble cast to star in this coming-of-age drama set in the world of competitive college cheerleading.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Marti is horrified to see her mom at qualifiers. When Charlotte (EMMA LAHANA), Savannah's sister and captain of the Hellcats' rival team, falls, Savannah makes a tough decision.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah is nervous about her first date with Dan, so Marti, Lewis and the rest of the Hellcats accompany her on the date. Marti tries to impress her law professor (GALE HAROLD).

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Lewis asks Marti out but she turns him down. Alice and Lewis have a sweaty workout together. Savannah and her mom (TERYL ROTHERY) fight when Dan comes to dinner.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah talks the team into letting Dan direct their bid video against Alice's wishes. Marti investigates further into Julian's (GALE HAROLD) case. Vanessa is fought over.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Things get messy when the girls' volleyball team challenges the Hellcats to a flag football game. Marti pretends to be sick to attend a conference with Julian (GALE HAROLD).

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats plan a date auction, but things take a turn when Savannah's old boyfriend shows up and outbids Dan, and Morgan (CRAIG ANDERSON) wins a date with a horrified Marti.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats plan an '80s party, complete with costumes and a musical number by Vanessa. Marti has conflicted feelings about Savannah and Dan spending the night together.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Marti is conflicted over her feelings for Dan and Lewis, and focuses on Travis' (BEN COTTON) case to keep her mind occupied. Musical guest FEFE DOBSON performs.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: After a compromising picture of Alice is sent around school, she vows revenge. Julian (GALE HAROLD) discovers Marti and Morgan (CRAIG ANDERSON) are investigating behind his back.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: After the incident in the car, Dan gives Marti an ultimatum -- to either admit she has feelings for him or their friendship is over. Marti decides to tell Savannah what happened.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: When Alice's father (guest star MARIO VAN PEEBLES) shows up at sectionals to watch her fly, she makes a drastic decision, blackmailing Savannah for her spot.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: In an effort to raise funds for sectionals, the Hellcats shoot a sexy calendar and throw a launch party with the band 3OH!3 -- and Savannah sings with them!

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: The Hellcats kidnap Marti for her initiation into the group. They flash back on how Savannah, Alice, Lewis and Vanessa became Hellcats.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: Savannah and Alice throw a toga party. Marti, Vanessa and Julian (GALE HAROLD) come up with a plan that just may get Travis (BEN COTTON) released from jail and save the Hellcats.

programme.title: Hellcats
programme.desc: A wedding forces Marti, Savannah and Dan to confront their true feelings. Vanessa and Derrick (D.B. WOODSIDE) face a tough decision. Alice visits Jake (RYAN KENNEDY) in jail.

programme.title: Hellcats

programme.title: Bionic Warriors
programme.desc: Cutting-edge technology is transforming wounded soldiers' lives. Bionic limbs are restoring hope, mobility, and purpose for amputee heroes.

programme.title: 21st Century Arms Race
programme.desc: Israeli defense experts shed light on advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning in the military defense sector.

programme.title: The Race To Forecast Weather
programme.desc: Today, 24-hour forecasts are 95% reliable and 3-day forecasts are 80% reliable. How do scientists predict the weather and, each year, improve their predictions? It's a race against time using the latest technologies.

programme.title: Mississippi Infant Mortality Emergency
programme.desc: Mississippi has declared a public health emergency over infant mortality. Scripps News reports from the Delta where miles, money, and missing services separate moms and babies from care.

programme.title: Roman In Red And Black
programme.desc: Filmed over three years, a Ukrainian sharpshooter's raw dispatches from the frontlines catch the world's attention. Scripps News traces Roman's journey from frontline legend to a soldier battling a new enemy that nearly finishes him: his own mind.

programme.title: Operation Royal Charm: Smuggler's Blues
programme.desc: FBI agent Lou Calverese goes undercover to infiltrate the lucrative world of international smuggling. What begins as a case of black market cigarettes soon involves military weapons, 100-dollar counterfeit bills and drugs, all entering US ports undetected. Calverese comes up with a brilliant take-down scheme to nab everyone involved in the smuggling - a personal invitation to his fabricated wedding. After receiving Rolex watches and other gifts, Calverese and the FBI do a takedown of the wedding guests.

programme.title: Operation Nautilus: Pakistani Hash On The High Seas
programme.desc: US Customs agent Paul DeCotiis is part of an international undercover plan to intercept 70 tons of Pakistani hashish in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. Customs uses a seized boat to meet the traffickers near Midway Island. High seas prevent most of the hash being transferred to the undercover boat, but Customs follows the drugs to the traffickers. DeCotiis is the point man throughout the operation between the Customs undercover team and a group of Canadian hippies hoping for a big payday. DeCotiis finally delivers the hash to the traffickers, resulting in several life sentences.

programme.title: ABC 10News at 5pm
programme.desc: ABC 10News at 5PM brings you breaking news, headlines, weather, traffic, sports, and entertainment & lifestyle

programme.title: Operation Chokehold: Busting Boston's Mob
programme.desc: FBI agent Vince delaMontaigne infiltrates the powerful La Cosa Nostra mob in an attempt to break their stranglehold on organized crime in Boston. To do this, delaMontaigne befriends Biagio DiGiacomo in the restaurant he owns and becomes one of the regulars who make deals and plot various ways to make a dishonest dollar. His efforts finally pay off but not before he's entangled in illegal betting, drug sales and extortion simply by playing his undercover role so well and being in the right place at the right time.

programme.desc: Follow what's happening across America with up-to-the minute details on the major events driving the day's top stories.

programme.title: Today As It Happened
programme.desc: What happened today? Find out as Scripps News gets you up to speed on the day's events that everyone is talking about.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A 12-year-old paperboy's disappearance during his Sunday morning route shocks a peaceful Iowa city. Panic sets in when a second paperboy goes missing.

programme.title: Target 7 Investigation: Broken Border
programme.desc: Target 7 looks at the changes happening on the southern border under the new administration.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: With the help of notable Kansas City locals Matt Besler, Kemet Coleman, and DJs Ice Kole & Joe, we discover a silent disco aboard a KC streetcar, explore The French Market, and make ourselves at home amongst the stars at Garozzo's Italian tavern.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Detectives are baffled after a mother and daughter in an affluent family are murdered outside Louisville. A year later, a triple homicide in North Carolina sends detectives on an explosive search, linking the two cases through an unlikely suspect.

programme.title: Very Local: Very New Mexico
programme.desc: Meet the hosts of the shows on Very Local, and learn about the programs highlighting The Land of Enchantment.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find the biggest cotton candy in the world, a massive collection of miniatures and a u-pick chili farm preserving New Mexican traditions? The same place with a stunning shortcut to peak climbing and the spark that lit the tech-boom!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: The mother-daughter dynamic duo of Cher and Sabria Delaine are best friends and do almost everything together except get out into nature. So Kinga meets up with ladies to mix things up and try to blend Cher’s island life with some southern comfort.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: People across the U.S. are thinking outside the box to live more sustainably.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: In what has to be the stinkiest episode we've ever had, Frank Nicotero asks Cincinnati locals wild and wacky news trivia. You'll be glad you can't smell some of these stories.

programme.title: Bands of Enchantment
programme.desc: Beloved Texas rockers Uncle Lucius return to the stage with a live set full of grit, soul, and hard-earned wisdom. Known for their cult following and timeless sound, they deliver roots rock that hits deep and lingers long after the lights fade.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: Truly Santa Fe
programme.desc: Join host Amanda Machon for a day of unforgettable adventure in Santa Fe, New Mexico! Alongside special guests, Amanda celebrates The Land of Enchantment, showcasing everything from world-class museums and restaurants to thrilling outdoor excursions.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin tests his mettle to see if he can compete in the Ironman World Championship. With only seven months to train and no prior experience, can Justin pull off this amazing fitness feat?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: It's not a Steelers game without the food. Chef Cory Hughes and Chef Les Murphy face off in the kitchen gridiron to see who can score the best Steelers tailgating dishes.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob takes the plunge with both old and new water-based activities, including paddleboard yoga, snowmobiling on the water, scuba diving and sailing.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Ivan Gomez is on a weight loss journey, but it’s one that’s been limited to exercising in his home. Kinga meets Ivan in Stockton, CA to show him how the outdoors can be a personal gym for body, mind and spirit.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: More than money makes the crime world go round. You won’t believe the odd array of goods that have been stolen over the years -- and the motivations behind the thefts.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Des Moines single Riley is ready for a second chance at love. Will a decor hunt spark creative chemistry, a pickleball match serve up a familiar connection or will axe-throwing hit the bullseye?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Known as one of the first cases of the digital age, Maura Murray's mysterious disappearance continues to confound investigators and internet sleuths.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Join us as we skip the line of Greenville's most sought after weekend eateries for brunch. We'll head to Southern Culture and enjoy music with our grits, check out the Bohemian's DIY Bloody Mary Bar, and round out the day with Biscuit Head and Hen Dough.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day explore the many sides of Lawrenceville. From sword fighting and thrifting to making wine and burgers, the guys experience the beauty of this eclectic neighborhood.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Gaten Matarazzo from Stranger Things and shares an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Boston.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob tests out all types of relaxation, from sound baths to flinging an axe, discovers exciting new cuisine and quenches his thirst in this diverse and hopping Boston ‘hood.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Having a little fun on the town is great but it's even better when you're doing it thriftily. Join Maddy & Dixie as they make a little cash go a long way, seeking out the best activities that’ll have you ballin’ on a budget!

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: New Orleans is heads above the rest when it comes to parades and the art scene. Three local artists will be put to the test to design a New Orleans cocktail-inspired headpiece. But will a design twist prove that these creations can hold water?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Kyle is a Louisville native and real estate agent that is on the market and looking for love. Three single guys will try to sell him a long term relationship by making bourbon, designing hats and taking a trip around the ice rink.

programme.title: On The Job
